securityAwarenessTrainingChecks.name: Employee Training Enrollment Coverage
securityAwarenessTrainingChecks.description: All employees should be enrolled in mandatory security awareness training programs

testResults.details: 98.4% enrollment coverage with automated HR system integration
Complete LMS integration with SSO and automated progress tracking
Training program covers FISMA, FedRAMP, and relevant industry standards

securityAwarenessTrainingChecks.remediation: Employee enrollment comprehensively implemented with strong automation and integration

securityAwarenessTrainingChecks.name: Training Completion Tracking and Analytics
securityAwarenessTrainingChecks.description: Security awareness training completion should be systematically tracked with analytics and reporting

testResults.details: 94.7% completion rate with detailed departmental performance analytics
78.9% knowledge retention with 23.4% security incident reduction
Complete automated reporting with executive dashboards and predictive analytics

securityAwarenessTrainingChecks.remediation: Training completion tracking comprehensively implemented with effective analytics and continuous improvement

securityAwarenessTrainingChecks.name: Incomplete Training Content Coverage
securityAwarenessTrainingChecks.description: Security awareness training lacks comprehensive coverage of critical cybersecurity topics

testResults.details: Limited coverage of emerging threats and mobile/cloud security topics
23% outdated content with 6-8 month delay in emerging threat integration
45% interactive content with limited gamification and no personalized learning

securityAwarenessTrainingChecks.remediation: MEDIUM PRIORITY: 1) Expand training content to include comprehensive coverage of mobile device security, cloud security, and data classification, 2) Develop emerging threat training modules for deepfakes, AI/ML security risks, and evolving ransomware tactics, 3) Implement monthly content updates with rapid emerging threat integration, 4) Enhance learning effectiveness with increased interactive elements, gamification, and scenario-based learning, 5) Develop personalized learning paths based on role and risk profile, 6) Improve accessibility with multi-language support and full mobile optimization

securityAwarenessTrainingChecks.name: Inadequate Training Frequency and Reinforcement
securityAwarenessTrainingChecks.description: Security awareness training lacks sufficient frequency and ongoing reinforcement mechanisms

testResults.details: Annual training only, 75% below recommended quarterly frequency
Knowledge retention drops to 43.7% at six months with no systematic refresher training
Minimal micro-learning, ad-hoc security tips, and basic simulated phishing program

securityAwarenessTrainingChecks.remediation: MEDIUM PRIORITY: 1) Implement quarterly comprehensive training with monthly micro-learning modules, 2) Develop automated reinforcement mechanisms including contextual learning and adaptive training paths, 3) Increase simulated phishing frequency to monthly with automated remedial training, 4) Implement just-in-time learning triggered by security events and risk indicators, 5) Establish continuous knowledge retention monitoring with automated refresher training recommendations, 6) Develop employee engagement programs with gamification, incentives, and recognition systems

securityAwarenessTrainingChecks.name: Limited Training Customization and Personalization
securityAwarenessTrainingChecks.description: Security awareness training lacks customization for different roles, departments, and risk profiles

roleBasedTrainingLimitations.departmentalCustomization: Limited to IT and Finance only

humanResources.specializationNeeds: Social engineering, data privacy, background checks

finance.specializationNeeds: Wire fraud, invoice manipulation, insider threats

testResults.details: 85% generic content with role-specific training limited to IT and Finance only
No personalized learning paths or adaptive content delivery capabilities
Training content doesn't address specific departmental risk profiles and specialization needs

securityAwarenessTrainingChecks.remediation: LOW PRIORITY: 1) Develop role-specific training content for all departments based on risk profiles and job functions, 2) Implement personalized learning paths with skill level assessment and adaptive content delivery, 3) Create departmental specialization modules addressing specific threat landscapes, 4) Deploy learning analytics to customize training based on individual progress and performance, 5) Establish role-based content library with automated customization engine, 6) Develop learning style adaptation capabilities to improve engagement and retention

securityAwarenessTrainingChecks.name: Insufficient Training Effectiveness Measurement
securityAwarenessTrainingChecks.description: Security awareness training lacks comprehensive effectiveness measurement and outcome validation

testResults.details: Limited to basic satisfaction surveys and multiple-choice quizzes with no behavior change tracking

testResults.test: Real-world application and impact measurement evaluation
testResults.details: Basic simulated phishing tracking with no correlation to incident response or security tool usage
Ad-hoc improvement process with no industry benchmarking or peer comparison

securityAwarenessTrainingChecks.remediation: MEDIUM PRIORITY: 1) Implement comprehensive Kirkpatrick four-level evaluation framework with behavior change tracking and business impact measurement, 2) Develop real-world application testing including social engineering simulations and incident response performance correlation, 3) Establish longitudinal effectiveness analysis with knowledge decay tracking and behavior sustainability measurement, 4) Create automated improvement feedback loop with actionable insights generation and content optimization, 5) Implement industry benchmarking and peer organization comparison capabilities, 6) Develop ROI calculation methodology with quantified organizational risk reduction metrics
